issue.title: "new-log-timestamp-format" does not work
issue.body:
Hi @PaulWay @misi ,

I added the parameter to the turnserver.conf file as below and then restart the turn, but timestamp is not logged. 

new-log-timestamp-format  "%y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"

or

new-log-timestamp-format "%FT%T%z"

On the other hand if I use only "new-log-timestamp", then it works. I used lots of format of timestamp but could not be successful. What's the correct format or is there any problem about formatting ?

2021-11-01T23:57:03+0300: IPv4. CLI authentication success: 127.0.0.1:38712
2021-11-01T23:57:08+0300: IPv4. CLI session disconnected from: 127.0.0.1:38712
2021-11-01T23:58:03+0300: IPv4. CLI connected to: 127.0.0.1:38714
2021-11-01T23:58:03+0300: IPv4. CLI authentication success: 127.0.0.1:38714
2021-11-01T23:58:08+0300: IPv4. CLI session disconnected from: 127.0.0.1:38714
2021-11-01T23:59:03+0300: IPv4. CLI connected to: 127.0.0.1:38716
2021-11-01T23:59:03+0300: IPv4. CLI authentication success: 127.0.0.1:38716

coTurn version: 4.5.2

Thanks,
Sena

comment.body:
@GD-Dheer - can you give us the `new-log-timestamp` lines of the config file that gives this error?

`new-log-timestamp` is a boolean - if it's present, the timestamps in the log are in the new format; if it's absent they are in the old format.  It does not take a value - i.e. it just appears as `new-log-timestamp`, not `new-log-timestamp=true`.

`new-log-timestamp-format` takes a string value.  This does not need to be quoted but it can be.  It can also be preceded by an '`=`' but it can be.  In other words you can do `new-log-timestamp-format=%F-%T`, `new-log-timestamp-format="%F %T"`, `new-log-timestamp-format %F-%T` or `new-log-timestamp-format "%F %T"`.  The quotes allow the value to include spaces.

The message `Bad configuration format` comes from failing to parse that argument.  If you can show us the line you're using, we can work out what's going wrong.

issue.body:
Hi @PaulWay @misi ,

I added the parameter to the turnserver.conf file as below and then restart the turn, but timestamp is not logged.

or

On the other hand if I use only "new-log-timestamp", then it works. I used lots of format of timestamp but could not be successful. What's the correct format or is there any problem about formatting ?

2021-11-01T23:57:03+0300: IPv4. CLI authentication success: 127.0.0.1:38712
2021-11-01T23:57:08+0300: IPv4. CLI session disconnected from: 127.0.0.1:38712
2021-11-01T23:58:03+0300: IPv4. CLI connected to: 127.0.0.1:38714

coTurn version: 4.5.2

Thanks,
Sena

comment.body:
> Testing this on `coturn v4.5.2` on `Ubuntu 20.04.5 LTS` I think I might be missing something, The `logfile` does not pick the timestamps even after enabling `new-log-timestamp` in the config file. I have commented out `syslog` and added this `log-file=/path/to/my/turnserver.log` but still the created logfile do not pick the timestamps. **Is there a way to enable timestamps in the log-files**

Did you ever find a solution to this? Restarting my coturn by hand gave me:
Bad configuration format: new-log-timestamp

issue.title: CMake Build doesn't detect Prometheus
issue.body:
I've noticed that the CMake build doesn't seem to detect Prometheus libraries, although configure can.

It seems like a script to find it would be needed based on the output from the CMake github automation: https://github.com/coturn/coturn/actions/runs/6622872744/job/17989011141#step:5:106  (note that the github automation does install prometheus, so it would be expected to find it)

There's some other libraries listed that also don't have a find script. Sorry for no PR on this, CMake scripting is outside my wheelhouse.

issue.title: coturn external-ip from DNS?
issue.body: I have a coturn server running on my NAT, but do not have a static IP address from my ISP. However, I have DDNS set up for all other network services, such that my domain name always points to my current IP address. Given the way coturn's config file works, I would have to script ddclient to rewrite coturn's config file with my current IP address and restart coturn to use the new config each time the address changes. It would be much easier if I could just supply a domain name for coturn to check the A record of in place of external-ip.

comment.body: I have pushed the idea of Coturn resolving its host domain name to the limit: [I have added](https://github.com/coturn/coturn/compare/master...coturn-codeveloper6092:coturn:dynamic-dns) the option `--external-hostname <hostname>/<private-ip>` which is similar to `--external-ip` but `<hostname>` is resolved every time when Coturn needs to know its public IP address.

issue.title: turnserver.conf Log Problem
issue.body:
Hi,

I use script for create turnserver.conf file. 
`  turnpass="$(/turnadmin -E -f /.key-p $turnpass)"`

When I check the file, I see the following incorrect output.

```
mysql-userdb="hostmy_ip dbname=mydb user=myuser password=0: (7008): INFO: System cpu num is 4
0: (7008): INFO: log file opened: /var/log/turn_2023-10-25.log
0: (7008): INFO: System enable num is 4
1HBsMn+Jk6YLCeCrtA2/pW== port=xxx connect_timeout=x"
```

"System enable num is" I see this in mainrelay.c. But I don't understand why it writes this log. I'm just trying to create a encrypted password.

issue.title: StunAttrAddr constructor logic error in src/client++/TurnMsgLib.h
cannot start TLS and DTLS listeners because private key file is not set properly
issue.body:
on my ubuntu 20 i tried to install coturn although i have created the config and point it to a certbot certficate no matter what i do i get this warning 

```
 #012CONFIG ERROR: Empty cli-password, and so telnet cli interface is disabled! Please set a non empty cli-password!
Jan 10 16:32:04 vps-7 turnserver: 0: WARNING: cannot find certificate file: turn_server_cert.pem (1)
Jan 10 16:32:04 vps-7 turnserver: 0: WARNING: cannot start TLS and DTLS listeners because certificate file is not set properly
Jan 10 16:32:04 vps-7 turnserver: 0: WARNING: cannot find private key file: turn_server_pkey.pem (1)
Jan 10 16:32:04 vps-7 turnserver: 0: WARNING: cannot start TLS and DTLS listeners because private key file is not set properly
```

also my certificate file doesn't called turn_server_cert.pem

whats wrong exactly in this case ?

issue.title: Support Windows MSVC
issue.body:
The following changes have been made:
1. Replace deprecated functions with new standard functions
2. Add corresponding MSVC functions for non-standard functions 
3. Remove warnings about unsafe functions
4. CMAKE: modify find pack Libevent and openssl 
5. Modify include files
6. Use pthread4W
7. Modify socket in windows
8. Add CI - github action
8.1. msvc
8.2. mingw
10. The database:
9.1. sqlite, pgsql, hiredis, mongo  is test compiled.
9.2. mysql, isnot test compiled.
11. The applications、server can be compiled and run successfully! 
12. Add vcpkg manifest mode in cmake.

comment.body: @KangLin: Thanks for your comment and your work!

issue.title: Error - TLS/TCP socket disconnected - reason: TLS/TCP socket buffer operation error (callback)
issue.body:
Hi Team,

We configured certificate in our coturn configuration and can see that it is able to find cert and key in the logs.
But apart form that Is there any way to identify it is working as expected using TLS protocol ?

comment.body: I solved similar error with setting network engine to 1 in both 4.6.2-debian and 4.6.2-alpine docker container (set ne=1 in turnserver.conf). the is no problem on 4.6.1 on openning udp ports for establishing call.

issue.title: Support Windows MSVC
issue.body:
The following changes have been made:
1. Replace deprecated functions with new standard functions
2. Add corresponding MSVC functions for non-standard functions 
3. Remove warnings about unsafe functions
4. CMAKE: modify find pack Libevent and openssl 
5. Modify include files
6. Use pthread4W
7. Modify socket in windows
8. Add CI - github action
8.1. msvc
8.2. mingw
10. The database:
9.1. sqlite, pgsql, hiredis, mongo  is test compiled.
9.2. mysql, isnot test compiled.
11. The applications、server can be compiled and run successfully! 
12. Add vcpkg manifest mode in cmake.
